intro: Mirandea andradenia, commonly known as the Andradena mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant belonging to the family Loranthaceae. It grows on the branches of host trees, primarily in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant has small, oval-shaped leaves and produces small, white or yellowish flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that releases tiny seeds, which can adhere to the bark of host trees. The botanical characteristics of Mirandea andradenia reflect its parasitic lifestyle, with specialized structures for nutrient absorption from its host.
